availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph W. Stivers (Bourbon County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier (major))

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Stivers. Father of Hooker Stivers and Sherman Stivers. Master carpenter in Bourbon County in 1860. Served as major in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry from August 21, 1862, to March 13, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 627.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, North Middletown, p. 341A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 372-373.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 948.
Find A Grave, "Maj. J. W. Stivers (1830-1881)," Memorial #87779277, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87779277 (accessed March 1, 2019).
